document.masterDocTitle: A key to species of genus Malcus Stål, with descriptions of four new species from China (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Malcidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A key to species of genus Malcus Stål, with descriptions of four new species from China (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Malcidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Zheng, L. Y. & Zou, H. G. & Hsiao, T. Y.
bibRefCitation.refString: Zheng, L. Y., Zou, H. G. & Hsiao, T. Y. (1979) New species of Chinese Lygaeidae (I) Malcinae (Hemipt. - Heteropt.). Acta Zootaxonomica Sinica, 4 (3), 273 - 280.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male description: The externally visible characters of male were similar as female.
Anterior part of 7 th ventrite of male sublaterally with protruding paired truncate processes ( Fig 31 ).

Malcus
species (All measured data of each species integrated from two resources: one is measured in this study, represented by “ N ”, means number of specimens measured in this study; the other one comes from previous resources, represented by “ MPR ”)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. This species closely resembles
M. noduliferus
, their head and pronotum without erect hairs and pronotum with significantly raised posterolateral tubercle. But
M. noduliferus
with distinct posteromedial tubercle, can easily be distinguished.

Material examined.
Holotype , ♀ ,
China : Yunnan :
Near Simao City , alt:
950m
,
17.v.1957
;
Paratype , ♀ , same data as the holotype
